lobbying_activities.description:
Medicare/Part B Premium Hold Harmless. H.R. 3631:  Provisions extending the current "hold harmless" policy to all Medicare enrollees to ensure 2010 Part B monthly premiums remain at the current rate. Comprehensive Health Care Reform. H.R. 3200, S. 1679, Senate Finance Committee Mark of Americas Healthy Futures Act: provisions related to reducing Medicare Advantage plan payments, reducing the coverage gap in Part D, requiring wealthier Medicare beneficiaries to pay a greater share of the cost of their premiums under Medicare Part D, reducing the Part A deductible, establishing an out-of-pocket maximum under Medicare, establishing a voluntary comprehensive benefit option under Medicare, authorizing a Medicare-operated Part D drug plan, permitting the Department of Health and Human Services to negotiate drug prices for the Part D program, simplifying plan benefit designs under Parts D and C, expanding benefits for low-income beneficiaries under the Medicare Savings Programs and the Part D Low-Income Subsidy (LIS), improving the process for reassigning LIS beneficiaries to new plans, expanding coverage of prevention services, integrating mental health services in primary care and community settings, eliminating the 45 percent funding trigger provision, establishing a Medicare Commission, providing Medicaid coverage for home and community-based services, establishing a new national insurance program for long-term supports and services, authorizing funding to provide language services to limited English proficiency beneficiaries, authorizing the collection of data regarding disparities in the provision of care, providing safeguards and subsidies to assure affordability of health coverage for seniors, preserving state benefit laws and requirements, reducing permitted age rating ratio and clarifying the Medicare Secondary Payer statute. 

Medicare/Commission.  S. 1110 and S. 1380:  authorizing an enhanced MedPAC as an executive branch commission with authority to implement Medicare payment and policy designed to reduce Medicare spending growth.

Medicare/Prescription Drug Plan.  S. 330/H.R. 684: authorizing the establishment of a Medicare-operated prescription drug plan; S. 266: authorizing the Secretary of Health and Human Services to negotiate lower prescription drug prices and to use the savings to reduce the coverage gap.

Medicare/Part D Generics.  S. 75:  requiring the use of generics where available unless the brand name drug is determined to be medically necessary.

Medicare/Part D cost-sharing. S. 1630:  establishing limits on required beneficiary cost-sharing under Part D drug plans.

Medicare/Part D dual eligibles. S. 1634:  removing enrollment barriers for low-income beneficiaries and establishing a Medicare-operated prescription drug plan. 

Medicare/Combating Waste, Fraud, Abuse.  H.R. 27:  relating to additional provisions to combat waste, fraud, and abuse within Medicare; H.R. 203:  increasing civil and criminal penalties for acts involving fraud and abuse and increasing the surety bond amount for suppliers of durable medical equipment.

Medicare/Therapy Caps.  H.R. 43/S. 46:  repealing outpatient rehabilitation therapy caps.

Medicare/Private Contracts.  H.R. 164:  prohibiting denial of Social Security benefits to persons who elect not to participate in Medicare.

Medicare/Hearing Coverage.  H.R. 504: authorizing coverage of hearing aids and auditory rehabilitation services under Medicare Part B.   

Medicare/Dental Coverage.  H.R. 870:  authoring coverage under Part B for medically necessary dental procedures.

Medicare/Rural Improvements.  H.R. 902/S. 382:  provision authorizing improvements to services provided to beneficiaries residing in rural areas.

Medicare/Shingles Vaccine.  H.R. 1038:  extending Part B coverage to the shingles vaccine.

Medicare/Home Health.  H.R. 1094:  authorizing home health care agencies to assign the most appropriate skilled service to make the initial assessment visit under a Medicare home health plan of care for rehabilitation services. Medicare/Health Care Vouchers.  H.R. 1118:  authorizing Medicare-eligible seniors to elect to receive vouchers for a health savings account, premiums for a high deductible health insurance plan, or both, in lieu of regular Medicare benefits and suspending Medicare late enrollment penalties between ages 65 and 70.
 
Medicare/Skilled Nursing Facilities.  H.R. 1125, S. 647:  provisions related to requiring the reporting of expenditures for nursing services at skilled nursing facilities and requiring disclosure of corporate ownership.

Medicare/Prevention.  H.R. 1213:  provisions authorizing ultrasound screening for abdominal aortic aneurysms to at-risk Medicare beneficiaries between the ages of 65 and 75 without the requirement of a prior initial preventive physical examination; H.R. 1894/S. 769:  expanding access to bone mass measurement benefits under Part B.   

Medicare/Part B Drug Payments.  H.R. 1392: relating to appropriate Part B payment amounts for drugs and biologicals.

Medicare/Low Income Prescription Drug Benefits.  H.R. 1407/S. 534:  authorizing a reduction in cost-sharing under Part D for non-institutionalized, full-benefit dual eligible individuals.

Medicare/Disability Benefits.  S. 700/H.R. 1708, H.R. 2881:  phasing-out the 24-month waiting period for disabled individuals to become eligible for Medicare benefits and eliminating the waiting period for individuals with life-threatening conditions. 

Medicare/Prescription Drugs for kidney transplants.  H.R. 1458/S. 565:  provision related to continued coverage for immunosuppressive drugs furnished beneficiaries that have received kidney transplants and whose entitlement to coverage would otherwise expire.

Medicare/Intravenous Drugs.  H.R. 1765/S.701:  relating to the payment for intravenous immune globulin (IVIG) for the treatment of primary immune deficiency diseases in a patient's home and for certain disposable pumps as durable medical equipment in place of non-disposable pumps.

Medicare/Home Infusion Therapy.  H.R. 574/S.254:  extending Medicare coverage to home infusion therapy.

Medicare/Physical Therapy Services.  H.R. 1829:  authorizing physical therapists to evaluate and treat Medicare beneficiaries without physician referral.

Medicare/Part D Premiums.  H.R. 1832:  limiting Part D premium increases to no more than the Social Security cost-of-living adjustment and requiring the Secretary of Health and Human Services to negotiate lower prescription drug prices.

Medicare/Cancer Hospice and Palliative Care.  H.R. 1844:  provisions authorizing coverage of comprehensive cancer care planning, establishing a Medicare hospice care demonstration, and authorizing grant programs for cancer palliative care and symptom management, provider education, and related research.

Medicare/Hospice and Advanced Care Planning. S. 1150, H.R. 2911: provisions related to changing hospice payments and providing advance care planning resources.

Medicare/Physician-Manufacturer Transparency.  S. 301:  increasing the transparency of the relationship between physicians and the manufacturers of drugs, devices, biologicals, and medical supplies.

Medicare/Care Coordination Services. S. 1131, H.R. 2560:  provisions establishing pilot care coordination program.

Medicaid/Home and Community-based Long Term Care.  S. 434, S.1257, H.R. 28552:  provisions to remove barriers to providing home and community-based services including providing a state option to provide home and community-based services to individuals for whom such services are likely to prevent, delay, or decrease the likelihood of an individual's need for institutionalized care and authorizing the implementation of assistance grants for states electing to provide home and community-based services under Medicaid; provisions to provide a single point of entry to long term services; provisions to support nursing home diversion programs. Medicaid/Community-based Attendant Services and Supports.  S. 683, H.R. 1670:  authorizing coverage of community-based attendant services and supports under Medicaid, increasing funding and establishing a demonstration program for beneficiaries dually eligible for Medicare and Medicaid.

Universal Coverage.  H.R.15, H.R.193, H.R. 676, H.R.1200, S. 4:  provisions providing health care or insurance for all U.S. residents and to control the cost and enhance the quality of the health care system. Importation of Prescription Drugs.  H.R. 163, H.R. 1298, S. 525:  provisions facilitating the importation of prescription drugs.

Health Information Technology.  H.R. 1031, H.R. 1039, S. 179, S. 444:  provisions facilitating the adoption of modern information technology.

Generic Drugs.  S. 369:  provision to prohibit brand name drug companies from compensating generic drug companies to delay the entry of a generic drug into the market. 

Long-Term Services and Supports.  S. 697/H.R.1721, H.R. 3200, S. 1679, Senate Finance Committee Mark of Americas Healthy Futures Act:  provisions providing assistance to individuals with functional impairments maintain their independence, authorizing establishment of a community living infrastructure, and providing assistance to family caregivers (CLASS Act).

Healthcare Workforce.  H.R. 468/S. 245, S. 750, H.R. 3098:  provisions relating to the recruitment, training, and support of health care professionals and direct care workers in support of older Americans.

Affordability of Health Coverage for Seniors.  S.1679:  provisions reducing allowable age rating ratio for health insurance premiums.

Employee Verification.  H.R. 662, H.R. 137, H.R. 1096:  provisions pertaining to the use of Social Security numbers for workforce verification and the responsibilities of the Social Security Administration relating to immigrants.

Fiscal Year 2010 Labor, HHS, Education, and Related Agencies Appropriations.  H.R. 3293:  provisions pertaining to funding the Social Security Administration, Older Americans Act programs, and Geriatric Education Centers and related programs. Fiscal Year 2010 Financial Services Appropriations/Economic Commission.  H.R. 3170:  pertaining to the creation of a commission to examine long-term fiscal imbalances facing the nation.

National Debt Ceiling (No bill number):  provision pertaining to the creation of a commission to examine long-term fiscal imbalances facing the nation.

Entitlement Commission. S. 276, H.R. 3116:  provisions establishing a National Commission on Entitlement Solvency to review and report to the President and Congress on the Social Security and Medicare programs and make recommendations and proposed legislative language. Social Security Cost of Living Adjustment for 2010 Replacement Benefit. H.R. 3626, H.R. 3672, H.R. 3597, S. 1685.  Provision providing a one-time, emergency benefit to seniors and persons with disabilities to compensate for the lack of a 2010 Social Security cost of living adjustment.

Social Security Cost of Living Adjustment.  H.R. 3557, H.R. 3572:  providing for a Social Security COLA in 2010.

Seniors' Cost of Living Adjustment (COLA). H.R. 1371/ H.R. 2429: provisions establishing a consumer price index for elderly consumers to compute cost-of-living increases for Social Security and Medicare benefits; authorizing a Cost of Living Adjustment for Social Security recipients in 2010 (No legislation introduced).

Social Security Private Accounts.  H.R. 107:  provision establishing Social Security private accounts. 

Social Security Trust Funds.  H.R. 1276, S. 86, H.R. 219, H.R. 1712:  provisions removing Social Security Trust Fund receipts and disbursements from the federal budget baseline, limiting Trust Fund proceeds to OASDI purposes, and prohibiting the use of Social Security payroll tax monies for private accounts.

Social Security Benefits.  S. 426:  requiring progressive indexing and longevity indexing of Social Security old-age insurance benefits.    

Social Security Government Pension Offset (GPO) and Windfall Elimination Provision (WEP).  S. 484, H. R. 235:  repealing both the GPO and WEP; S. 490, H. R. 1221:  repealing the WEP.

Older Workers/Workforce Participation.  S. 502:  promoting the labor force participation of older Americans.

Pension Distribution.  H.R.424, H.R. 939:  provisions relating to the suspension of minimum distribution rules for tax-deferred retirement plans.

Public Pension Modifications.  H.R. 1804:  provisions safeguarding spousal benefits with respect to Civil Service Retirement System (CSRS) pensions, the Thrift Savings Plan (TSP) and the Federal Employees Retirement System (FERS).

Womens Pension Improvements and Protections (No bill number): provisions to improve working womens pension plan participation and pension account accumulation, and safeguard spousal rights pertaining to pensions at divorce.
